Person.Organization: DANA-FARBER CANCER INSTSLOAN-KETTERING INST CAN RESEARCH

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
HTAN expects that users of data will acknowledge in all presentations and publications the relevant data generator(s), corresponding grant(s), and dataset(s).
HTAN ACKNOWLEDGMENT STATEMENT: “The results published here are in whole or in part based upon data generated by [Name, Center, Institution] with support from the Human Tumor Atlas Network, grant(s) [U24CAxxxxxx, U2CCAxxxxxx, and/or Task Order No. HHSN261100039 under Contract No. HHSN261201500003I].”
HTAN ACCESSION NUMBERS: The acknowledgment statement should include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
HTAN PERIOD OF EXCLUSIVITY FOR CONTRIBUTING INVESTIGATORS: Data released to public databases is considered pre-publication until it appears in a peer-reviewed publication. All users of data, whether members of HTAN or of the wider community, should be aware of the publication status of data being used and treat it accordingly. Users of data are expected to act in accordance with the Ft. Lauderdale guidelines regarding use and publication of both pre-publication and published data, as follows: (1) For up to one year following public release of data, users interested in publishing on pre-publication data should obtain the consent of the data generator(s) before using such data in their own publications, and the data generator(s) should not unreasonably withhold this consent. (2) Users interested in publishing on pre-publication data should discuss their results with the data generator(s) and are encouraged to establish collaborations. However, HTAN members are not required to collaborate with any outside investigators nor the users required to establish a collaboration with an HTAN investigator. (3) Users should cite the source and version of all data and should acknowledge the data generator(s) as specified in the Attribution section below. (4) All scientific community members, through their roles as journal and grant reviewers, should enforce a high standard of respect for the scientific contribution of data generator(s).
The full HTAN EXTERNAL DATA SHARING POLICY can be found here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zEbYvxQs54585X7VHYoMt6jTmBtXQLQ1cVk2WCm2sfA/edit#heading=h.werhhzwpgmvl

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.
